text: Donald George Bragg (May 15, 1935 - February 16, 2019) was an American athlete. He competed mainly in the pole vault. He won a gold medal in that event at the 1960 Summer Olympics in Rome.Don Bragg . sports-reference.com Bragg was born in Penns Grove, New Jersey. Bragg died at his home in Northern California of complications from dementia on February 16, 2019, aged 83. ==References== Category:1935 births Category:2019 deaths Category:Deaths from dementia Category:Disease-related deaths in California Category:American track and field athletes Category:Olympic gold medalists for the United States Category:Sportspeople from New Jersey Category:Pole vaulters
title: Don Bragg
